title: Dragonkin

properties.name: description
properties.value: The dragonkin are a race of powerful and intelligent dragon-like creatures who were known to humans as powerful and malevolent creatures that spread destruction wherever they went. In battle, they have been seen to use exceptionally powerful dragonbreath.

content:
The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:Dragonkin

The dragonkin are a race of powerful and intelligent dragon-like creatures who were known to humans as powerful and malevolent creatures that spread destruction wherever they went. In battle, they have been seen to use exceptionally powerful dragonbreath.

Contents

  • 1 History
    • 1.1 Fourth Age
    • 1.2 Fifth Age
  • 2 Abilities
  • 3 Language
    • 3.1 Translated
    • 3.2 Untranslated
  • 4 The Ancient Cavern
  • 5 The Dragonkin's symbol
  • 6 Known Dragonkin
  • 7 Trivia

The dragonkin are the original creators of armour and weaponry based on Orikalkum, a material which is known by adventurers as dragon equipment. They are also the creators of dragons and other related species.

There are two factions of Dragonkin, the Necrosyrtes and Dactyl. The Necrosyrtes are Dragonkin who have succumbed to the curse and embrace its power, while the Dactyl are Dragonkin who resist the pull of the Stone and try to find ways to lift it.

History[edit | edit source]

At some point, they were enslaved by Jas and given the task of guarding the Stone of Jas. When one uses the Stone, the dragonkin feel pain and, eventually, become enraged, causing them to seek out destruction; they refer to this pain as the "Curse".

The Stone was taken to Kethsi, where its inhabitants misused the stone for their own benefit. This caused the Dragonkin much pain, and the Necrosyrtes soon discovered Kethsi's location due to their link to the Stone. Although the Kethsians soon fought back with bane weaponry, killing numerous Necrosyrtes, although by that time, they had been on the decline and soon went extinct. The Dactyl learned of this dangerous weaponry, but chose not to take any action, which proved to be a fatal mistake during the Fourth Age.

However, not all dragonkin fully succumb to the Curse; some, such as Zorgoth, resist the curse and choose to focus on lifting it through many experiments in laboratories hidden throughout the world, such as Crandor, Ungael, and Lithkren. As they are unable to reproduce, they attempted to create beings of the same lineage as themselves, yet not born of them directly, resulting in the creation of dragons.

While most knowledge on the Dragonkin is fairly unknown, recent discoveries have attempted to piece together what little knowledge they have of them.

Karuulm, tired of the God Wars raging during the Third Age, moved to Mount Karuulm to begin their own experiments. Free of their fellow Dragonkin who criticised their work, they began working on multiple experiments with the unique resources to the mountain. This Dragonkin started with wyrms and drakes, both of which they considered failures. They then began working on hydras, who began to show them promising results. Using the unique chemicals to the mountain, he eventually created an enhanced version which showed even more promise, but nonetheless deemed it a failure because he could not replicate it. Eventually, they abandoned their laboratory on Mount Karuulm and relocated south to Mount Quidamortem after hearing of a unique lizard species, though it is unknown what happened to them at that point. It is likely their work culminated into the Great Olm, given its draconic-like appearance and attacks.

Another Dragonkin moved to the Poison Waste and created several serpents, one of which would grow into Zulrah. This Dragonkin was eaten by Zulrah and its snakelings, ignoring warning signs that it intended to eat them as they were distracted by the sheer intelligence and strength their former "Vorkath" had obtained.

Fourth Age[edit | edit source]

Aivas, Tristan, Odysseus, Robert the Strong, and Camorra confronting the dragonkin on Lithkren.

During the Fourth Age, dragonkin who succumbed to the Curse attacked human settlements, which prompted heroes such as Robert the Strong, Tristan, Aivas, and Camorra to drive them back.

One such battle took place on Lithkren, where the four slayed a dragonkin who attempted to open the doors leading to the Lithkren Vault, ready to release their "ultimate weapon". Fearing what may lie behind those doors, the heroes decided to split the dragon key the dragonkin left behind and hid the pieces around the world.

Fossil Island was found by the Dragonkin Skeka, who was a peaceful dragonkin. Zorgoth eventually found Skeka and the island during the Fourth Age, surprised that she was still alive, but Skeka refused to let him utilise her island for his experiments. It is unknown if anyone else was working with Skeka, but she is believed to be the creator of the wyverns due to their presence in the island's cave system.

Fifth Age[edit | edit source]

Zorgoth, a dragonkin, appears before the adventurer, Bob, and Dallas.

During the Fifth Age, an adventurer and Dallas Jones, an expert on dragons, heedlessly opened the Lithkren Vault, whose key was split by the Fourth Age heroes long ago. Doing so freed Zorgoth, a dragonkin who was sealed behind the doors. Because humans were not willing to distinguish the aggressive dragonkin from the peaceful ones, he has grown to spite humanity and perfected the ultimate weapon, Galvek, during his imprisonment.

The adventurer battles Galvek, while the leaders and heroes fight against brutal black dragons.

Seeing the threat Zorgoth posed to the world, the kingdoms of Gielinor, namely Asgarnia, Misthalin, Kandarin, as well as the Fremennik Province, Burthorpe, and Camelot, stood united against the dragonkin threat, planning an assault on Ungael, where the dragons of the world are gathering.

The assault was a success, resulting in the defeat of Galvek and Zorgoth, but not without many casualties from the united kingdoms, and Bob the Cat.

Abilities[edit | edit source]

A Dragonkin in battle against Robert the Strong.

Not much of dragonkin combat has been seen, but what has been witnessed is evidence of tremendous power. During the battle on Lithkren in the Fourth Age, Aivas, Tristan, Odysseus, Robert the Strong, and Camorra slayed a dragonkin, but not without sustaining heavy injuries and the death of Aivas.

In addition, during a battle against Robert after the battle on Lithkren, another dragonkin used powerful magic, almost killing him, after having defeated his loyal sidekick Odysseus. However, Robert managed to retaliate and slay the dragonkin.

Language[edit | edit source]

The dragonkin have a language, of which little is known, as they speak in the common tongue most of the time. The language and sentence structure is direct and simple, which follows something like below:

Subject - Adjective if required - Action modifier - Action - Object.

The only example of dragonkin language being in Old School RuneScape is a shrine found in the northern portion of the Wyvern Cave, whereupon examining it will state "Forcae castil draekeun. Ortha lokur. Lith kletter ortha lokur. Draekeun fia Lithkren." This can be roughly translated as Forcae combine dragon. First steel. Superior green first steel. Dragon safe from Lithkren. Forcae is the name of the dragonkin who created adamant and rune dragons, while Lithkren is the name of a fortress built by a dragonkin, who the author of the ancient diary knew.

Most of these words were taken from the live game's Dragonkin Primer or other texts from the live game, which Old School Jagex Moderators have used in related content.

Translated[edit | edit source]

  • Arakken = Dungeon
  • Castil = Combine
  • Chen = Razed/Destroyed
  • Crasortius = Surrender
  • Draekeun = Dragon
  • Drakkerkin = Dragonkin
  • Fia = Safe/Protected from
  • Galvek = Fate
  • Gres = East
  • Hesente = Intruder
  • Kath = Failure/Weakling/Runt
  • Kalist = Catalyst, sometimes Stone of Jas
  • Kletter = Green
  • Kreath = Dark/Shadow/Black
  • Kren = Fortress?
  • Lith = Superior
  • Lokur = Steel
  • Ortha = First
  • Tho = South
  • Verak = King/Emperor?
  • Vor = Pathetic
  • Vosk = False User

Untranslated[edit | edit source]

  • Askanth
  • Carratas
  • Dosk
  • Falkar
  • Hok
  • Kalgat
  • Kel
  • Kuln
  • Pthen
  • Reageth
  • Roake
  • Sokun
  • Traken
  • Ven
  • Volat
  • Tescan
  • Tesska

The Ancient Cavern[edit | edit source]

The Dragon forge

The dragonkin are known to have created the Ancient Cavern underneath Baxtorian Falls, as the several ancient pages from my notes suggests the cave appeared artificial in origin and suggested dragonkin involvement. The Ancient Cavern also contains a forge used to smith the dragon platebody and dragon kiteshield; this further supports the idea that the dragonkin created dragon equipment, as Bob states that they created a forge hot enough to work with Orikalkum.

The compass rose symbol, which is the right half of the symbol to the right and the full Dragonkin Symbol.

The Dragonkin's symbol[edit | edit source]

The Dragonkin symbol representing their binding to the Stone of Jas .

The Dragonkin are associated with a symbol with visual similarities to the Stone of Jas. It consists of a circle with a compass rose in the right half, and on the left half, a pattern identical to the one found on the Stone of Jas. There is also another Dragonkin symbol, which is only the compass rose without the Stone. This is because the Dragonkin symbol is actually a full compass rose, the half-stone-half-rose symbolises the Dragonkin's bonding to the curse of Jas. The symbol is seen on the floor in the hallway before entering the Lithkren Vault. The compass symbols are shown around the main symbol. The compass symbol is also seen on the floor of their castle from A Tail of Two Cats.

Known Dragonkin[edit | edit source]

  • Forcae, who created adamant and rune dragons. He is mentioned in the Wyvern Cave on Fossil Island.
  • Garak, a dragonkin who was known to have destroyed a number of small settlements near the border of the Wilderness during the Dragonkin Conflicts.
  • Kerapac, an influential dragonkin mentioned in the old notes in the Karuulm Slayer Dungeon.
  • Karuulm, who recreated Wyrms and created Drakes and Hydras. He wrote the old notes in the Karuulm Slayer Dungeon, which are compiled in the Mount Karuulm diary.
  • Skeka, a dragonkin who lived on Fossil Island and presumably created the Wyverns.
  • Zorgoth, featured in Dragon Slayer II and the creator of some metal dragons as well as Galvek.
  • Unnamed dragonkin:
    • Dragonkin (A Tail of Two Cats), defeated in the Fourth Age by Robert the Strong.
    • Dragonkin (Dragon Slayer II), defeated in the Fourth Age by Robert the Strong and his allies.

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • Dragonkin share a similar appearance to the Skeksis from the 1982 fantasy film The Dark Crystal. It was confirmed by Mod Mark during the London RuneFest get-together (28 January 2011) that the Dragonkin were actually based on Skeksis, due to his love of the movie The Dark Crystal.

{{External|rs}}
[[File:Dragonkin (Dragon Slayer II).png|right|170px]]
The '''dragonkin''' are a [[race]] of powerful and intelligent dragon-like creatures who were known to [[human]]s as powerful and malevolent creatures that spread destruction wherever they went. In battle, they have been seen to use exceptionally powerful dragonbreath.

{{ToC|left|limit=1}}
The dragonkin are the original creators of armour and weaponry based on Orikalkum, a material which is known by adventurers as [[dragon equipment]]. They are also the creators of dragons and other related species.

There are two factions of Dragonkin, the {{RSL|Necrosyrtes|Necrosyrtes}} and {{RSL|Dactyl|Dactyl}}. The Necrosyrtes are Dragonkin who have succumbed to the curse and embrace its power, while the Dactyl are Dragonkin who resist the pull of the Stone and try to find ways to lift it.

==History==
At some point, they were enslaved by Jas and given the task of guarding the [[Stone of Jas]]. When one uses the Stone, the dragonkin feel pain and, eventually, become enraged, causing them to seek out destruction; they refer to this pain as the "Curse".

The Stone was taken to Kethsi, where its inhabitants misused the stone for their own benefit. This caused the Dragonkin much pain, and the Necrosyrtes soon discovered Kethsi's location due to their link to the Stone. Although the Kethsians soon fought back with bane weaponry, killing numerous Necrosyrtes, although by that time, they had been on the decline and soon went extinct. The Dactyl learned of this dangerous weaponry, but chose not to take any action, which proved to be a fatal mistake during the Fourth Age.

However, not all dragonkin fully succumb to the Curse; some, such as [[Zorgoth]], resist the curse and choose to focus on lifting it through many experiments in laboratories hidden throughout the world, such as [[Crandor]], [[Ungael]], and [[Lithkren]]. As they are unable to reproduce, they attempted to create beings of the same lineage as themselves, yet not born of them directly, resulting in the creation of [[dragon (race)|dragons]].

While most knowledge on the Dragonkin is fairly unknown, recent discoveries have attempted to piece together what little knowledge they have of them.

[[Karuulm]], tired of the God Wars raging during the Third Age, moved to [[Mount Karuulm]] to begin their own experiments. Free of their fellow Dragonkin who criticised their work, they began working on multiple experiments with the unique resources to the mountain. This Dragonkin started with [[wyrm]]s and [[drake]]s, both of which they considered failures. They then began working on [[hydra]]s, who began to show them promising results. Using the unique chemicals to the mountain, he eventually created [[Alchemical Hydra|an enhanced]] version which showed even more promise, but nonetheless deemed it a failure because he could not replicate it. Eventually, they abandoned their laboratory on Mount Karuulm and relocated south to [[Mount Quidamortem]] after hearing of a unique lizard species, though it is unknown what happened to them at that point. It is likely their work culminated into the [[Great Olm]], given its draconic-like appearance and attacks.

Another Dragonkin moved to the [[Poison Waste]] and created several serpents, one of which would grow into [[Zulrah]]. This Dragonkin was eaten by Zulrah and its snakelings, ignoring warning signs that it intended to eat them as they were distracted by the sheer intelligence and strength their former "Vorkath" had obtained.

===Fourth Age===
[[File:Dragon Slayer II - confronting dragonkin.png|thumb|left|230px|[[Aivas]], [[Tristan]], [[Odysseus]], [[Robert the Strong]], and [[Camorra]] confronting the dragonkin on [[Lithkren]].]]

During the Fourth Age, dragonkin who succumbed to the Curse [[Dragonkin Conflicts|attacked human settlements]], which prompted heroes such as [[Robert the Strong]], [[Tristan]], [[Aivas]], and [[Camorra]] to drive them back.

One such battle took place on [[Lithkren]], where the four slayed a [[Dragonkin (Dragon Slayer II)|dragonkin]] who attempted to open the doors leading to the [[Lithkren Vault]], ready to release their "ultimate weapon". Fearing what may lie behind those doors, the heroes decided to split the [[dragon key]] the dragonkin left behind and hid the [[dragon key pieces|pieces]] around the world.

[[Fossil Island]] was found by the Dragonkin [[Skeka]], who was a peaceful dragonkin. Zorgoth eventually found Skeka and the island during the Fourth Age, surprised that she was still alive, but Skeka refused to let him utilise her island for his experiments. It is unknown if anyone else was working with Skeka, but she is believed to be the creator of the wyverns due to their presence in the island's cave system.

===Fifth Age===
[[File:Dragon Slayer II - Zorgoth appears.png|thumb|230px|Zorgoth, a dragonkin, appears before the adventurer, Bob, and Dallas.]]
During the [[Fifth Age]], an adventurer and [[Dallas Jones]], an expert on dragons, heedlessly opened the [[Lithkren Vault]], whose key was split by the Fourth Age heroes long ago. Doing so freed [[Zorgoth]], a dragonkin who was sealed behind the doors. Because humans were not willing to distinguish the aggressive dragonkin from the peaceful ones, he has grown to spite humanity and perfected the ultimate weapon, [[Galvek]], during his imprisonment.

[[File:Dragon Slayer II - Galvek's tsunami.png|thumb|left|230px|The adventurer battles Galvek, while the leaders and heroes fight against [[brutal black dragon]]s.]]

Seeing the threat Zorgoth posed to the world, the kingdoms of Gielinor, namely [[Asgarnia]], [[Misthalin]], [[Kandarin]], as well as the [[Fremennik Province]], [[Burthorpe]], and [[Camelot]], stood united against the dragonkin threat, planning an assault on [[Ungael]], where the dragons of the world are gathering.

The assault was a success, resulting in the defeat of [[Galvek]] and [[Zorgoth]], but not without many casualties from the united kingdoms, and [[Bob the Cat]].

==Abilities==
[[File:A Tail of Two Cats - Robert vs the Dragonkin.png|left|thumb|250px|A Dragonkin in battle against Robert the Strong.]]
Not much of dragonkin combat has been seen, but what has been witnessed is evidence of tremendous power. During the battle on [[Lithkren]] in the [[Fourth Age]], [[Aivas]], [[Tristan]], [[Odysseus]], [[Robert the Strong]], and [[Camorra]] slayed a [[Dragonkin (Dragon Slayer II)|dragonkin]], but not without sustaining heavy injuries and the death of Aivas.

In addition, during a battle against Robert after the battle on Lithkren, another [[Dragonkin (A Tail of Two Cats)|dragonkin]] used powerful magic, almost killing him, after having defeated his loyal sidekick [[Odysseus]]. However, Robert managed to retaliate and slay the dragonkin.

==Language==
The dragonkin have a language, of which little is known, as they speak in the common tongue most of the time. The language and sentence structure is direct and simple, which follows something like below:

Subject - Adjective if required - Action modifier - Action - Object.

The only example of dragonkin language being in ''Old School RuneScape'' is a shrine found in the northern portion of the [[Wyvern Cave]], whereupon examining it will state "Forcae castil draekeun. Ortha lokur. Lith kletter ortha lokur. Draekeun fia Lithkren." This can be roughly translated as ''Forcae combine dragon. First steel. Superior green first steel. Dragon safe from Lithkren''. {{RSL|Forcae|Forcae}} is the name of the dragonkin who created [[Adamant dragon|adamant]] and [[rune dragon]]s, while [[Lithkren]] is the name of a fortress built by a dragonkin, who the author of the [[ancient diary]] knew.

Most of these words were taken from the live game's {{RSL|Dragonkin Primer|Dragonkin Primer}} or other texts from the live game, which Old School Jagex Moderators have used in related content.

===Translated===
*Arakken = Dungeon
*Castil = Combine
*Chen = Razed/Destroyed
*Crasortius = Surrender
*Draekeun = Dragon
*Drakkerkin = Dragonkin
*Fia = Safe/Protected from
*Galvek = Fate
*Gres = East
*Hesente = Intruder
*Kath = Failure/Weakling/Runt
*Kalist = Catalyst, sometimes Stone of Jas
*Kletter = Green
*Kreath = Dark/Shadow/Black
*Kren = Fortress?
*Lith = Superior
*Lokur = Steel
*Ortha = First
*Tho = South
*Verak = King/Emperor?
*Vor = Pathetic
*Vosk = False User

===Untranslated===
*Askanth
*Carratas
*Dosk
*Falkar
*Hok
*Kalgat
*Kel
*Kuln
*Pthen
*Reageth
*Roake
*Sokun
*Traken
*Ven
*Volat
*Tescan
*Tesska

==The Ancient Cavern==
[[File:Dragon forge - DS2.png|left|thumb|The [[Dragon forge]]]]
The dragonkin are known to have created the [[Ancient Cavern]] underneath [[Baxtorian Falls]], as the several [[ancient page]]s from [[my notes]] suggests the cave appeared artificial in origin and suggested dragonkin involvement. The Ancient Cavern also contains [[dragon forge|a forge]] used to smith the [[dragon platebody]] and [[dragon kiteshield]]; this further supports the idea that the dragonkin created dragon equipment, as [[Bob (cat)|Bob]] states that they created a forge hot enough to work with [[Orikalkum]].

[[File:Dragonkin compass.png|left|thumb|The compass rose symbol, which is the right half of the symbol to the right and the full Dragonkin Symbol.]]

==The Dragonkin's symbol==
[[File:Dragonkin symbol.png|thumb|The Dragonkin symbol representing their binding to the Stone of Jas .]]
The Dragonkin are associated with a symbol with visual similarities to the Stone of Jas. It consists of a circle with a {{wp|compass rose}} in the right half, and on the left half, a pattern identical to the one found on the Stone of Jas. There is also another Dragonkin symbol, which is only the compass rose without the Stone. This is because the Dragonkin symbol is actually a full compass rose, the half-stone-half-rose symbolises the Dragonkin's bonding to the curse of Jas. The symbol is seen on the floor in the hallway before entering the [[Lithkren Vault]]. The compass symbols are shown around the main symbol. The compass symbol is also seen on the floor of their castle from [[A Tail of Two Cats]].

==Known Dragonkin==
*[[Forcae]], who created adamant and rune dragons. He is mentioned in the [[Wyvern Cave]] on [[Fossil Island]].
*[[Garak]], a dragonkin who was known to have destroyed a number of small settlements near the border of the [[Wilderness]] during the [[Dragonkin Conflicts]].
*[[Kerapac]], an influential dragonkin mentioned in the [[Old notes (Karuulm Slayer Dungeon)|old notes]] in the [[Karuulm Slayer Dungeon]].
*[[Karuulm]], who recreated [[Wyrm]]s and created [[Drake]]s and [[Hydra]]s. He wrote the [[Old notes (Karuulm Slayer Dungeon)|old notes]] in the [[Karuulm Slayer Dungeon]], which are compiled in the [[Mount Karuulm diary]].
*[[Skeka]], a dragonkin who lived on [[Fossil Island]] and presumably created the [[Wyvern]]s.
*[[Zorgoth]], featured in [[Dragon Slayer II]] and the creator of some metal dragons as well as [[Galvek]].
*Unnamed dragonkin:
**[[Dragonkin (A Tail of Two Cats)]], defeated in the [[Fourth Age]] by [[Robert the Strong]].
**[[Dragonkin (Dragon Slayer II)]], defeated in the [[Fourth Age]] by [[Robert the Strong]] and his allies.

==Trivia==
*Dragonkin share a similar appearance to the Skeksis from the 1982 fantasy film ''{{wp|The Dark Crystal}}''. It was confirmed by Mod Mark during the London RuneFest get-together (28 January 2011) that the Dragonkin were actually based on Skeksis, due to his love of the movie ''The Dark Crystal''.
